medical_history.chief_complaint: Blepharospasm characterized by irregular eye spasms.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. A first experienced eyelid spasm in the same month her husband developed a seizure disorder. The spasm gradually increased in intensity over 5 months, forcing her to quit her factory job. After her nephew was murdered, the spasm intensified and was accompanied by shortness of breath. A similar exacerbation occurred 2 years after her nephew's death when her husband was hospitalized for seizures.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 10-year history of rheumatoid arthritis involving hand and knee joints, managed with aspirin.
medical_history.family_history: The patient is the fifth oldest of 10 children; her father died when she was 7 years old, and her mother relinquished custody of the children. Significant life stressors include her husband's seizure disorder and the murder of her favorite nephew.
medical_history.social_history: Married; worked in a factory for 31 years. Ms. A describes a stable, mutually dependent relationship with her husband and has no children.
